problem.p: A disk of mass \(M\) and radius \(R\) is rotating about its axis. A small cylinder of mass \(m\) and very small radius is placed on the surface of the disk at a distance \(R/2\) from the center. The disk is rotating with angular speed \( \omega \). The cylinder does not move relative to the disk.
What is the moment of inertia (about the center of mass of the disk) for the object consisting of the disk and the cylinder?
